xxl.core.relational.cursors
Class Mapper

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<E>
      xxl.core.cursors.mappers.Mapper<Tuple,Tuple>
          xxl.core.relational.cursors.Mapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Iterator<Tuple>, Cursor<Tuple>, MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Orenstein.FloatPointKPEzCodeMapper
public class Mapper
extends Mapper<Tuple,Tuple>
implements MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>

A Mapper invokes a given metadata mapping function on an input metadata cursor array.
The mapping function is applied to n input cursors at the same time, that means a n-dimensional function is called and its arguments are one element of each input cursor. The result is an object that is returned by the mapper.
Also a partial input is allowed with the intention to apply the mapping function on less than n arguments (see allowPartialInput).

IMPORTANT: The function of the mapper is called with a list of arguments.

See Also:
MetaDataFunction

Constructor Detail

Mapper

public Mapper(MetaDataFunction<? super Tuple,? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>> mapping,
              boolean allowPartialInput,
              MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>... cursors)
Constructs a Mapper object that invokes a given metadata mapping function on an input metadata cursor array.
The mapping function is applied to n input cursors at the same time, that means a n-dimensional function is called and its arguments are one element of each input cursor. The result is an object that is returned by the mapper.
Also a partial input is allowed with the intention to apply the mapping function on less than n arguments (see allowPartialInput).

IMPORTANT: The function of the mapper is called with a list of arguments.

Parameters:
mapping - a metadata function that maps a list of objects (one object per input cursor) to a new object (output). The function also has to deliver the metadata for the output.
allowPartialInput - true if the function can be applied if not every cursor delivers an input object.
cursors - the metadata cursors delivering the input.

Mapper

public Mapper(MetaDataFunction<? super Tuple,? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>> mapping,
              MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>... cursors)
Constructs a Mapper object that invokes a given metadata mapping function on an input metadata cursor array.
The mapping function is applied to n input cursors at the same time, that means a n-dimensional function is called and its arguments are one element of each input cursor. The result is an object that is returned by the mapper.
Partial input is not allowed.

IMPORTANT: The function of the mapper is called with a list of arguments.

Parameters:
mapping - a metadata function that maps a list of objects (one object per input cursor) to a new object (output). The function also has to deliver the metadata for the output.
cursors - the metadata cursors delivering the input.

Mapper

public Mapper(MetaDataFunction<? super Tuple,? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>> mapping,
              Function<? super java.sql.ResultSet,? extends Tuple> createTuple,
              java.sql.ResultSet resultSet)
Constructs a Mapper object that invokes a given metadata mapping function on an input ResultSet and returns an iteration containing the resulting objects.

IMPORTANT: The function of the mapper is called with a list of arguments.

Parameters:
mapping - a metadata function that maps a list of objects (one object per input cursor) to a new object (output). The function also has to deliver the metadata for the output.
createTuple - a function that maps a (row of the) result set to a tuple. The function gets a result set and maps the current row to a tuple. It is forbidden to call the next, update and similar methods of the result set!
resultSet - the result set that delivers the input relation.
